intro: Oenothera alyssoides var. typica, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its milky sap, which contains various bioactive compounds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
